quotes.quote: He that struggles with us strengthens our nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.
I have a high respect for your nerves. They are my old friends.
Laugh at yourself, but don't ever aim your doubt at yourself. Be bold. When you embark for strange places, don't leave any of yourself safely on shore. Have the nerve to go into unexplored territory.
It destroys one's nerves to be amiable every day to the same human being.
In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
I think the whole nerves thing comes into play when we worry about what other people and society will think.
A game of chess is not an examination of knowledge; it is a battle of nerves.
If you trust your nerve as well as your skill, you're capable of a lot more than you can imagine.
Losing a position is aggravating, whereas losing your nerve is devastating.
If your Nerve, deny you - Go above your Nerve
You need a certain amount of nerve to be a writer.
Nerves provide me with energy... It's when I don't have them, when I feel at ease, that's when I get worried.
Unnerved, the nerve, you're nervous, nervous that I'm right.
Nerves and butterflies are fine - they're a physical sign that you're mentally ready and eager. You have to get the butterflies to fly in formation, that's the trick.
Set up another case bartender! The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
It's a funny thing, the less people have to live for, the less nerve they have to risk losing nothing.
Acting touches nerves you have absolutely no control over.
I have no nerves, no emotion, no pressure.
When a doctor does go wrong he is the first of criminals. He has nerve and he has knowledge.
Competition can be the most nerve-racking experience. Some people just thrive on it.
Often it feels like I am breathing today only because a few years back I had no idea which nerve to cut.
